intro: Crossopetalum densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower crossopetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically evergreen, glossy, and arranged in whorls around the stem. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
